required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 3M Oral Rinse Incidence and Patient Acceptance of Sloughing When Used With Sodium Lauryl Sulfate (SLS) Toothpastes
clinical_study.official_title: 3M Oral Rinse Evaluation of Incidence and Patient Acceptance of Sloughing When Used With Sodium Lauryl Sulfate (SLS) Toothpastes

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the incidence of oral tissue sloughing through self-report by study subjects and by professional dental examinations.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the incidence of oral tissue sloughing through self-report by study subjects and by professional dental examinations. Adverse events will be tracked through study dental examinations and subject diaries with twice daily use of the 3M Oral Rinse used in combination with toothpaste containing one of three levels (no, medium, high) of Sodium Lauryl Sulfate (SLS).
Determine the subjects' acceptance of sloughing and/or other side effects

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study was designed as an imbalanced 2 Period Crossover Study. However, the study was terminated during the washout period and the results reported here reflect only the period 1 results.
study_design_info.masking_description: Assessors did not know what toothpaste subjects used.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Reported Oral Mucosal Exfoliation Adverse Event (Oral Sloughing Incidence)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of incidence rate of oral sloughing as assessed by the subject and/or assessor

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With a Given Range of Average Oral Mucosal Sloughing Index Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Average score based on the mean of sloughing scores over 12 intra-oral areas. The sloughing score uses a 6 point scale as follows: 0= no sloughing, 1=flecks of desquamation, 2=sheets of desquamation, 3=redness, not due to plaque, 4=erosion of mucosa, 5=ulcerated areas. The twelve intra-oral areas of the mouth are as follows: dorsal and ventral surfaces of the tongue, floor and roof of the mouth, right and left buccal mucosa, gingival tissue. (upper right, upper anterior, upper left, lower left, lower anterior, lower right)

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With a Given Range of Average Oral Mucosal Sloughing Index Scores.
secondary_outcome.description: Average score based on the mean of sloughing scores over 12 intra-oral areas. The sloughing score uses a 6 point scale as follows: 0= no sloughing, 1=flecks of desquamation, 2=sheets of desquamation, 3=redness, not due to plaque, 4=erosion of mucosa, 5=ulcerated areas. The twelve intra-oral areas of the mouth are as follows: dorsal and ventral surfaces of the tongue, floor and roof of the mouth, right and left buccal mucosa, gingival tissue. (upper right, upper anterior, upper left, lower left, lower anterior, lower right)

other_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants Reporting Their Acceptance Levels of Side Effects
other_outcome.description: Subjects were questioned regarding how acceptable were your side effects. Using the following responses of: Completely unacceptable, somewhat unacceptable, somewhat acceptable, completely acceptable, did not experience side effects

arm_group.description: 3M Oral Rinse in combination with no SLS toothpaste (A)
3M Oral Rinse in combination with medium SLS toothpaste (B)
3M Oral Rinse in combination with high SLS toothpaste (C)

intervention.description: Less than or equal to X ppm Sodium Lauryl Sulfate
More than or equal to X ppm Sodium Lauryl Sulfate
Rinse prevents bacterial adherence to teeth

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Comparator: No SLS Toothpaste
group.description: 3M Oral Rinse in combination with no SLS toothpaste (A) No SLS toothpaste: Toothpaste no Sodium Lauryl Phosphate Anti-plaque: Rinse prevents bacterial adherence to teeth

group.title: Comparator: Medium SLS Toothpaste
group.description: 3M Oral Rinse in combination with medium SLS toothpaste (B) Medium SLS toothpaste: Less than or equal to X ppm Sodium Lauryl Phosphate Anti-plaque: Rinse prevents bacterial adherence to teeth

group.title: Comparator: High SLS Toothpaste
group.description: 3M Oral Rinse in combination with high SLS toothpaste (C) High SLS toothpaste: More than or equal to X ppm Sodium Lauryl Phosphate Anti-plaque: Rinse prevents bacterial adherence to teeth

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Generalized Fisher's Exact Test was used to detect an association between the 3 treatment groups and the incidence of sloughing

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The major limitation with this study is that the sample size goal was not reached given the early termination during the washout period of a two-period crossover design.
